definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
poor/destitute/to use up/to exhaust/thoroughly/extremely/(coll.) persistently and pointlessly

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera

sentences.english: Lift our country from the state of “poverty and blankness”.
sentences.chinese: 改變我國一窮二白的面貌。

sentences.english: But first the city has to be created from scratch.
sentences.chinese: 但是城市的創建要從一窮二白的基礎上開始。

sentences.english: There is nothing in some of these countries.

definition: lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
plethora of things to tackle/multitude of loose ends/very complicated/chaotic
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
